newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama stock exchange to get new clearing system.
newsitem.headline: Panama stock exchange to get new clearing system.

text.p: Panama's Stock Exchange will have a electronic clearing system by the end of the year, Stock Exchange President Roberto Brenes said.
The computerized system, called The Panamanian Clearing and Settlement, Inc (Panaclear), will make transactions more accurate and safer, Brenes said Tuesday.
Financing was provided from the Inter-American Development Bank through a $2.9 million program to automate stock exchanges throughout Central America, he said.

"The goal is to automate the stock exchange and have a link with other clearing systems like Euroclear. It will also give increased participation to smaller and intermediate clients that participate on the stock exchange," Brenes said.
